From the manufacturer


One of America's Leading USB Charging Brand.

PowerDrive by Anker:

  • PowerDrive is our acclaimed series of powerful, portable in-car USB chargers, built using only premium materials and the most advanced charging technology.

Anker PowerDrive 2

The 24W 2-port USB Car Charger for Phones, Tablets and more

PowerDrive 2 condenses twin-port high-speed charging into an incredibly compact power source for any phones or tablets on the road.

  • Remarkably compact, with twin charging ports
  • Two ports with the power to charge two iPads at high speed
  • PowerIQ for customized, high-speed charging
Read more

Super-Compact:

Two ports in one exceptionally sleek and slim unit. A gently glowing LED helps locate ports for night-time driving without being distracting.

Read more

Features




Faster Charging

Our PowerIQ and other advanced technologies charge your devices faster. Charge two iPads together at full-speed.

Extensive Compatibility

Intelligent high-speed USB charging for just about any phone, tablet, or other USB device.

Uncompromising Safety Standards

Our unique MultiProtect Safety System protects against shorts, surges and other dangers to keep you and your devices safe.

Read more
Upgraded

A redesigned and completely updated version with further-optimized form and function.

Only Premium Components

PowerDrive 2 is made using high-grade components and materials, with world-class chips and circuitry.

Peace of Mind Included

If you have any questions, our friendly customer service team will be more than happy to help out.

For Optimal Use:

  • Use your original cable or a third-party certified one (such as MFi).
  • Compatible with the new 12" MacBook, Apple / Android phones, tablets, and other USB-charged devices.
  • Not compatible with iPod nano, iPod Classic, iPod Shuffle, HP TouchPad, and Asus tablets.
  • We recommend charging your MacBook while it's turned off or in sleep mode (5-hour recharge time).

Product description

Color:Black

AMERICA'S LEADING USB CHARGING BRAND

- Faster and safer charging with our leading technology
- 10 million+ happy users and counting

Anker PowerDrive 2
24W 2-port USB car charger for phones, tablets & more

Advanced Charging Technology
Exclusive to Anker, PowerIQ and VoltageBoost combine to ensure the fastest possible charge, whatever device you have. (Does not support Qualcomm Quick Charge)

Ultra High Power
Two ports pump out 24 watts of power. That's enough to charge two iPads simultaneously!

MultiProtect Safety System
Surge protection, temperature control and more advanced safety features keep you and your devices safe.

Compact Design
PowerDrive 2 Lite is slim, sleek, and incredibly compact to stay out of the way when plugged in.

World Famous Warranty
At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support.

For Optimal Use:
Use your original cable or a third-party certified one (such as MFi).
Compatible with the new 12" MacBook, Apple and Android smartphones, tablets (including the Nexus 7) and other USB-charged devices except for the iPod nano, iPod Classic, iPod Shuffle, HP TouchPad and Asus tablets.
We recommend charging your MacBook while it's turned off or in sleep mode (5-hour recharge time).

Note:
If a port isn't working properly, your device may have triggered the protective internal safety switch. In order to reset the switch, unplug all cables for five minutes and retry.
Not compatible with 2009 Toyota Camry Hybrid.

Heidi Q
5.0 out of 5 starsUPDATED August 22, 2018: Bottom Port Draining Power, Not Charging. Top Port Very Fast
July 15, 2018
Color: BlackVerified Purchase
UPDATE: Anker contacted me almost immediately after I posted this review. In two days I had a new Car Charger, and so far it is working perfectly. I cannot recommend Anker products highly enough. Everything we have purchased fro Anker has been of excellent quality, and this one unit that had a problem was promptly replaced with excellent customer service help.
Original Review: This charger, along with 1/2 dozen Anker cords, has been amazing. I have 2 of the chargers. However yesterday my daughter told me the charger was draining her battery on the lower port. I knew she couldn't be correct, so today I plugged in my phone at 40%. It dropped immediately to 39%. No worries, the lightening bolt showed it was charging. Then the app I was loading kept resetting. Next I noticed the power was 38%, then 37. What?? I switched the power cord into the upper port and opened my Amazon app to see the reviews. It was interesting to see someone else felt it was resetting their phone or an app as well. It's been about 7 minutes and my phone has gone from 37 to 48% on that time using the top port. I am sure Anker will make it good, but I wanted to share this as a review in case someone else experiences the same thing. Overall I love Anker products and I will continue to buy them without question, but I expect both ports to charge. I can't say if this occurred before or if it is a new issue. Perhaps we've only used the top charger successfully, because I know we've had two phones plugged in many times.

Sean VanMeter
1.0 out of 5 starsCharges more slowly than my old 12W charger
June 19, 2017
Color: BlackVerified Purchase
I ordered this charger after the 12W charger I had been using in my car stopped working. I was very excited, expecting this one to charge my devices twice as fast. I almost always use a navigation app on my phone when I drive, and that is a big battery drain. My old charger would charge my phone very slowly when I was using that app, gaining a percent of charge about every 10 minutes. Well, with this charger, my phone LOSES a percent of charge every two minutes while I'm using the navigation app. Since so many of the reviews for this product praise the fast charging speed, I decided to give Anker the benefit of the doubt. I ordered one of their cables to use with the charging unit, since the Anker cables are supposed to allow for the fastest charging speed. Unfortunately, swapping out the cable made no difference in the rate of charging.

If you want to use a navigation app on your phone while you drive, don't waste your money on this unit. You're better off grabbing a charger from a convenience store.
